intro: Tuberaria variabilis var. brevipes, commonly known as the short-stemmed tuberaria, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Capparaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces fleshy, tuberous roots that store water, allowing it to survive in arid conditions. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas. Its flowers bloom in early spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and flies.
